subject: Re: Learning Junit
msgSnippet: Hi, another piece of advice from an other newbie :) I´ve found it totally distracting that there are tutorials and docs on JUnit 3.8 as well as JUnit 4.0
messageBody:
Hi,

another piece of advice from an other newbie :)

I´ve found it totally distracting that there are tutorials and docs on
JUnit 3.8 as well as JUnit 4.0 available. One might get really
confused by the mixture of different conventions (as I did, having
started the research).

If you want to focus on the newest version od JUnit, watch out reading
the tutorials. As I said, the two versions have totally different
naming conventions, the older one being deprecated by the new one.
Here's a brilliant advice on how to recognize the two styles:
http://www.instrumentalservices.com/content/view/45/52/

Sad but true, if I hadn't found that very article, I would still be
confused. Even though the docs attached to the downloadable version of
JUnit 4.0 cover the new convention, the samples are still unchanged.

Have fun learning, as I'm having for a few days :)


Anna Skawińska
